title: Report, result, goals as hosts usurp Barcelona at top of La Liga without Kylian Mbappe
desc: Report, result and analysis as Vinicius Junior converts two penalties for Madrid against Sociedad, with Kylian Mbappe staying on the bench.

title: Humiliation for Putin as staggering Russian death count unveiled - full list
desc: An investigation has revealed the identity of thousands of Russian soldiers who have lost their lives in Putin's war with Ukraine.

title: Two-year ban on taking shellfish and seaweed from rockpools north of Auckland
desc: The ban is for all of the Whangaparāoa Peninsula, and further north at Kawau Bay and Ōmaha Bay.

desc: The ban is for all of the Whangaparāoa Peninsula, and further north at Kawau Bay and Ōmaha Bay.

title: Mohamed Salah recaptures scintillating form as Liverpool see off Brighton
desc: Liverpool cruised into the fifth round of the FA Cup with a comfortable 3-0 win over Brighton at Anfield

title: Liverpool player ratings vs Brighton: Anfield rises for Mohamed Salah! Egyptian king receives standing ovation after shining in FA Cup win
desc: GOAL dishes out ratings to all of the Liverpool players involved in Saturday's FA Cup clash with Brighton, as the Reds recorded a 3-0 win at Anfield to book their place in the fifth round

title: JUBI SPECKMAN | How fertiliser economics shapes food security
desc: Two conferences held in Africa this week reminded us that resources alone do not create prosperity — systems do, writes Jubi Speckman.

title: A modern Singapore home designed around light and greenery
desc: White screens and tall street trees create a borrowed green view, while oak, stone and generous spaces make the interiors feel warm and liveable.

title: The bumper-bashing that changed three women’s lives
desc: In the Randburg magistrate’s court on Wednesday, Candice Adams pleaded guilty to assaulting Zandile Mbazima. She was fined R6,000, given a three-year suspended sentence and declared unfit to own a firearm.

title: Dominik Szoboszlai scores a screamer for Liverpool as they thump Brighton to march on in the FA Cup
desc: Curtis Jones’ first goal in over a year paved the way for Liverpool’s progress into the fifth round of the FA Cup with a 3-0 victory over Brighton at Anfield.
